channel.title: 75-94 Magic
channel.description:
What would be the best way? alch? I currently have 30k alchs on the go to hit 85 then it would be another 70k alchs to 94, costing about 20m overall or something.
75-94 will take a total of 92 hours of pure alching. ouchie
what are the different ways of training magic and how fast / cost effective are they

item.title: 75-94 Magic
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I always log in with separate computers (Mac OS X and Windows 7), because they likely check operating system information (for stats reasons) because in one of their articles they have a little FAQ at the bottom that asks, if two people in the same household log in and trade between each other, is that legitimate.

They say yes of course, providing that they’re not owned by the same person. That way, I have a little scenario that I could give them which sounds fairly believable and if they do check operating system information - it would back it up.

I still drop trade between accounts though if it is over 10m, but have them logged in at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: 75-94 Magic
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:45, topic:381701”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=477506.msg3498214#msg3498214 date=1297514882]
Im pretty sure its not against the rules, but you would need to consult them first to be 100% sure.
[/quote]It is aganist the rules, and has always been. Mark Gerhard wants to change this though[/quote]

Yes, it’s against the rules for more than one account owned by the same person to be logged in at the same time. From a technical standpoint though, if you run the unsigned client on both of them, they can’t really say if it’s the same computer/person or just two computers on the same private network logging in. Of course don’t set the same recovery questions and the like though.

That still isn’t to say they can’t ban you because of it, many people seem to have the faulty notion that Jagex is some totally fair company who only bans when proof is beyond a reasonable doubt, when there is nothing saying they have to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: 75-94 Magic
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I wouldn’t give a shit if I had maxed every skill, because I already have them. I’m not going to be pissy just because others may have a chance of earning it a bit quicker for a (comparatively) small amount of time.

If they permanently increased exp rates, that would be another argument. But it is, in comparison to the hundreds of hours needed to max skills, a small amount of time.

PS: What are you alching ollie?

Read full topic

item.title: 75-94 Magic
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:26, topic:381701”]I wasn’t playing for that. But I don’t see what would be wrong with it? Complaining for the sake of complaining.[/quote]I like the vast majority of updates, but that one i wasn’t fond of. Maxing skills out is supposed to be a slow and tedious process (as the game has no real difficulty). By simplifying it now, they basically gave the finger to those who have played for a very long time maxing shit out with no aid from that. So essentially those people wasted 10 hours extra on their skill.

Read full topic

item.title: 75-94 Magic
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:24, topic:381701”][quote author=Newty link=topic=477506.msg3494401#msg3494401 date=1297199056]

Why was it dumb? Was just a holiday event.

In what way does that constitute a double xp gift? Why would they change from giving away items like scarfs, kites, etc that give no advantage to something like hati gloves that ease game mechanics.
[/quote]

It doesn’t ease game mechanics. It gives you an extra reward during a certain time period. Besides, why would it matter? What rules are set in place that states they can’t do this? Why should they just stick to the typical holiday events? Why can’t they change it?

Such a stupid reason to hate it. HURR DURR IT IS DIFFERENT.[/quote]Did you support the double exp weekend?

Read full topic
